title: 🌛 "I never dreamed about success. I worked for it." - Estée Lauder
content:
You’re given two integer arrays (n and m), and an integer k. Using the digits from n and m, return the largest number you can of length k.

Example:

n = [3,4,6,5] m = [9,0,2,5,8,3] k = 5 $ maxNum(n, m, k) $ 98655

Note: The original message here had a typo where the answer said 98653!
